meanings.definition: To depend on with full trust or confidence.
meanings.sent1: She relied on her best friend to help her with the project.
meanings.sent2: The hiker relied on his map to find his way back to the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The cat relied on its owner to open the can of food.
meanings.sent4: The old bridge relied on rusty cables to hold it up.
meanings.sent5: The student relied on his notes to pass the exam.

meanings.definition: To have confidence or faith in.
meanings.sent1: He relied on his lucky charm to bring him good luck.
meanings.sent2: The team relied on their captain to lead them to victory.
meanings.sent3: The child relied on the tooth fairy to leave money under the pillow.
meanings.sent4: The farmer relied on the rain to water his crops.
meanings.sent5: The patient relied on the doctor's expertise to get better.
